breadcrumbs.message: Don't simplify - handles unicode edge cases
Core config management. generateId() uses Math.random (not cryptographically secure, but fine for IDs). findConfigPath walks up to filesystem root - correct. Good error handling.
Minimal JSON output helpers. outputError writes to stderr (correct). Consider adding exitCode param to outputError for consistency.
Good validation flow. Checks severity, date, TTL before modifying config. Prevents duplicates via path normalization. Uses resolve() consistently.
Simple removal by path or ID. Uses non-null assertion (line 51) after findIndex - safe because breadcrumb was just found. Good error messages.
Efficient single-pass partitioning. Dry-run mode is useful. Idempotent (no config = success). Only writes if changes made.
WIP claiming with session/TTL scope. DEFAULT_TTL 2h when no session available (platform-agnostic). Good fallback design.
Idempotent release (always succeeds). Session-aware: releases own claims if session present, TTL-only claims otherwise. Smart design.
Session cleanup. Trims and validates session ID. Handles missing config gracefully. Returns removed breadcrumb list for transparency.
Solid Zod schema definitions. ID regex validation is tight (b_XXXXXX). Expires field accepts ISO datetime or YYYY-MM-DD.
Well-structured types. All interfaces properly typed. Severity type used across codebase.
Clean suggestion generation. SEVERITY_PRIORITY co-located here. extractFirstSentence avoids splitting on periods in filenames.
Simple init with --force option. Reuses saveConfig for consistency.
Recursive check with O(1) deduplication via Set. Skips hidden dirs and node_modules. Exit codes: 0=clear/info, 1=warn.
Single-pass filtering and stats collection. Sorts by severity then path. Efficient O(n) implementation.
Single-pass stats collection. Categorizes claims vs warnings efficiently. Counts unique sessions.
TTL/expiration logic. DURATION_REGEX pre-compiled. Non-null assertions on regex captures for noUncheckedIndexedAccess.
Bun-only: Uses native Bun.Glob for pattern matching and file scanning. Cached cwd, pre-compiled regex. Zero npm glob dependencies.
Bun-only: Uses native Bun.sleep for async waiting. Configurable timeout/poll. Only blocks on active claims.
Entry point with Bun runtime check. Gives helpful install instructions if run with Node.js.
